name: Raspberry Pi 5 8GB
description: It is a PC used to transmit high-quality video and audio signals between devices using a single cable, as well as charge devices and transfer data using a USB Type A-Micro cable.

name: ESP32 DEV
description: The ESP32 DEV is a development board based on the ESP32 microcontroller, which integrates Wi-Fi and Bluetooth capabilities. It's designed for prototyping and developing various IoT applications, offering a wide array of GPIO pins, making it highly versatile for connecting sensors, displays, and other peripherals.

name: ESP32 S3
description: The ESP32-S3 is a low-power system-on-chip (SoC) with a dual-core microprocessor and a low-power coprocessor, primarily designed for AIoT applications. It supports 2.4 GHz Wi-Fi and Bluetooth Low Energy (Bluetooth 5/LE), offers powerful AI acceleration, and features reliable security like cryptographic hardware accelerators. It also has a rich set of I/O peripherals and supports multiple low-power modes.

name: ESP32 C3
description: The ESP32-C3 is a low-cost, RISC-V-based microcontroller with Wi-Fi and Bluetooth LE connectivity, designed for efficient IoT applications and offering strong security features.

name: ESP32 CAM
description: The ESP32 CAM is a microcontroller board featuring a high-performance ESP32 chip with integrated Wi-Fi, Bluetooth, and a camera (OV2640 or OV7670). It's used for IoT projects requiring image processing, video surveillance, or remote monitoring, enabling applications in smart homes, industrial automation, and smart agriculture. It includes an SD card reader and ample GPIO pins for flexible integration with other sensors and devices, and can be programmed to function as a live streaming camera web server.

name: ESP8266/ NodeMCU
description: NodeMCU is an open-source firmware and development kit, typically based on the ESP8266 Wi-Fi chip. Its function is to help prototype or build IoT products, using the Lua scripting language for applications like connected devices and home automation.

name: Arduino UNO R3
description: The Arduino UNO R3 is a popular open-source microcontroller board based on the ATmega328P. It is used for building and programming electronic projects, serving as the brain that reads inputs (from sensors, buttons, etc.) and controls outputs (like motors, LEDs, displays) according to programmed instructions. It is widely used by beginners for its simplicity and large community support.

name: Arduino WiFi [Atmega + NodeMCU]
description: An Arduino board combined with a NodeMCU (which uses an ESP8266/ESP32 WiFi SOC) to enable network connectivity (WiFi) and powerful microcontroller capabilities. This hybrid board allows for IoT projects requiring both traditional Arduino-style programming/peripherals and robust wireless communication for internet connection, web servers, and data transmission.

name: STM32
description: The STM32 is a family of 32-bit microcontroller integrated circuits by STMicroelectronics. It's known for its high performance, real-time capabilities, digital signal processing, and low power consumption. It is widely used in embedded systems and IoT devices as a core processor for controlling various functions and peripherals.

name: Arduino Leonardo
description: The Arduino Leonardo is a microcontroller board based on the ATmega32u4, which features built-in USB communication. This allows it to function as a Human Interface Device (HID), such as a mouse or keyboard, when connected to a computer, in addition to a virtual serial port.

name: Arduino Leonardo Pro Micro
description: A compact microcontroller board often used for projects requiring USB human interface device (HID) capabilities, as its ATmega32U4 chip allows it to appear as a keyboard or mouse to a connected computer.

name: ESP32 CAM ADAPTER
description: An adapter board designed to facilitate easier programming and connection of the ESP32-CAM module, often providing necessary pins and a power interface.

name: 5'' TFT DISPLAY
description: A 5-inch Thin-Film Transistor (TFT) display is a type of Liquid Crystal Display (LCD) that uses TFT technology to improve image quality, providing a higher-resolution and more colorful display. When it is a "TOUCH DISPLAY," it means it is equipped with a touchscreen overlay, allowing users to interact directly with the display via touch input, making it suitable for human-machine interface (HMI) applications, graphical user interfaces in IoT projects, and embedded systems requiring interactive visual output.

name: 2.8"  TFT DISPLAY
description: A 2.8" TFT Display is a compact, thin-film transistor liquid-crystal display often used in IoT and embedded systems for showing graphical user interfaces, data, and status information.

name: 2.4" TFT DISPLAY
description: A 2.4" TFT display is a small, color liquid-crystal display (LCD) commonly used in IoT projects to provide a visual interface. It typically has a resistive or capacitive touch screen, allowing for user interaction and display of information like sensor readings, status, or graphical user interfaces.

name: 2.24" OLED DISPLAY
description: A 2.24" OLED display module is a graphic display made of 128x64 OLED pixels, often with an SSD1309 controller. It typically communicates via 4-wire SPI or I2C serial interface. OLED displays are advantageous for being thin, lightweight, and having low power consumption, as they only power the necessary pixels.

name: 0.96" OLED DISPLAY
description: A 0.96" OLED Display is a small, low-power display module often used in microcontrollers and IoT projects to show information like sensor readings, status updates, or small graphics. It uses Organic Light-Emitting Diodes (OLED) which offer high contrast and wide viewing angles, without needing a backlight.

name: SOLAR PANEL 80X40
description: A solar panel with dimensions of 80x40 mm designed to convert sunlight into electrical energy, specifically providing a 5V output. It's used for powering small IoT devices or charging batteries in remote or low-power applications.

name: SOLAR PANEL 69X66
description: A solar panel of this size (69x66) and rating (5V) is used to convert sunlight into electrical energy, typically for charging batteries or powering low-power 5V electronic devices in outdoor or remote IoT applications.

name: SOLAR PANEL 280X170
description: A solar panel of size 280x170 and 12V is designed to convert sunlight into electrical energy, specifically providing a 12-volt output, suitable for charging 12V batteries or powering small to medium-sized electronics in IoT projects where a higher voltage is needed, such as remote monitoring stations or small off-grid devices.

name: 18650 LI-ION BATTERY
description: A rechargeable lithium-ion battery cell that provides electrical energy. It is commonly used in applications requiring high energy density, long life, and lightweight batteries, such as laptops, power tools, electric vehicles, and drones.

name: 18650 LI-ION BATTERY CASE 3X3
description: A holder designed to safely store and connect three 18650 Li-ion batteries in a 3x3 configuration, often used to create a battery pack for IoT projects.

name: 18650 LI-ION BATTERY CASE 2X2
description: Holds two 18650 lithium-ion batteries, typically used to provide power to electronic or IoT projects.

name: 18650 LI-ION BATTERY CASE 1X1
description: A holder designed to safely house a single 18650 lithium-ion battery, often used in DIY electronics and IoT projects to provide power.

name: BREAD BOARD
description: A Breadboard is a solderless construction base used for prototyping electronic circuits. It allows for temporary circuits to be built and tested easily without the need for soldering.

name: PCB BOARD 7X9
description: A Printed Circuit Board (PCB) 7x9 is a physical board used to mechanically support and electrically connect electronic components using conductive pathways, tracks, or signal traces etched from copper sheets laminated onto a non-conductive substrate. The 7x9 likely refers to the size in units, often used for prototyping and permanent circuit assembly.

name: PCB BOARD 13X25
description: A Printed Circuit Board (PCB) is a board used to mechanically support and electrically connect electronic components using conductive pathways, tracks, and pads etched from copper sheets laminated onto a non-conductive substrate. The 13X25 dimension refers to the board size in some unit (likely cm or mm), indicating it's a prototyping or project board.

name: 4WD CAR SET
description: A 4WD Car Set is a kit used to build a remote-controlled or autonomous vehicle that powers all four wheels simultaneously, providing enhanced traction and control, especially for off-road or uneven terrain applications. This allows it to move effectively and carry sensors/components for IoT projects.

name: 4WD MOTOR
description: A 4WD motor is a gear motor typically used in small robotic or IoT car chassis to drive the wheels, providing power and torque for movement.

name: GEAR MOTOR
description: A gear motor is a combination of an electric motor and a speed reducer (gearbox) in one unit. Its function is to reduce the rotational speed of the motor while simultaneously increasing the output torque, making it suitable for applications that require moving heavy loads at low speeds, such as conveyors or machine tools.

name: SERVO MOTOR
description: A servo motor is a rotary actuator that allows for precise control of angular position, velocity, and acceleration. It is used in applications that require accuracy, such as robotics, CNC machines, and automated manufacturing systems.

name: TPP223 TOUCH SENSOR
description: The TTP223 TOUCH SENSOR is a capacitive touch pad detector IC that functions as a single touch key, designed to replace traditional direct button keys. It features low power consumption and stable touching detection.

name: DHT11 SENSOR
description: The DHT11 is a low-cost digital sensor used for sensing both temperature and humidity.

name: PIR SENSOR
description: A Passive Infrared (PIR) sensor detects motion by measuring infrared light radiating from objects, typically used to sense whether a human has moved in or out of the sensor's range. It is commonly used in security alarms and automatic lighting.

name: HC-SR04
description: The HC-SR04 is an ultrasonic distance sensor that measures the distance to an object using sound waves (40kHz pulses). It consists of a transmitter and a receiver. It has a maximum range of 4m and a minimum range of 2cm, with a ranging accuracy of 3mm.

name: MPU-6050
description: The MPU-6050 is a six-axis motion tracking device that combines a 3-axis gyroscope and a 3-axis accelerometer. It is commonly used in IoT projects to measure acceleration, velocity, orientation, and gravity.

name: MAX 98357A DRIVER
description: The MAX 98357A DRIVER is a Class-D digital input audio amplifier designed to drive speakers with an impedance of 4Ω or more. It accepts standard I2S, Left-Justified, or TDM digital audio data and can operate on a single 2.5V to 5.5V supply. It is often used in filterless applications and features selectable gains.

name: LDR SENSOR
description: The LDR SENSOR (Light Dependent Resistor) is a type of resistor whose resistance changes based on the intensity of light. Its resistance decreases as the light level increases, operating on the principle of photoconductivity. It is typically used to detect the presence and intensity of light in applications like automatic lights and light-sensitive alarms.

name: PWM DC SPEED CONTROLLER
description: A PWM DC Speed Controller regulates the rotational speed of a DC motor by using Pulse Width Modulation to rapidly switch the power supply on and off, effectively controlling the average voltage supplied to the motor.

name: KY-022 Infrared (IR)
description: 5NOS IR typically refers to a module with 5 Infrared (IR) sensor pairs (transmitter and receiver). Its function is to detect infrared light, usually for tasks like line following in robots, obstacle avoidance, or counting objects, by sensing reflected light.

name: PN532 MODULE
description: The PN532 module is a Near Field Communication (NFC) controller for contactless communication at 13.56 MHz, supporting NFCIP-1, ISO/IEC 14443A/MIFARE, ISO/IEC 14443B, and FeliCa protocols for reading and writing NFC/RFID tags and cards.

name: PN532 NFC
description: The PN532 NFC is a Near Field Communication (NFC) controller module often used with microcontrollers like Arduino to enable NFC/RFID capabilities. It supports contactless communication at 13.56MHz, ISO14443 Type A and Type B protocols, and various NFC/RFID cards (like MIFARE/NTAG2xx). It can function in Reader/Writer, Card Emulation, and Peer-to-Peer modes.

name: NFC CARD
description: An NFC Card is a passive device containing a small chip and antenna that stores and transmits data wirelessly when brought near an NFC reader. It is commonly used for contactless payments, access control, and data exchange.

name: NFC RING
description: An NFC Ring typically contains a near-field communication chip that allows it to interact with NFC-enabled devices (like smartphones or readers) for tasks such as unlocking phones, sharing information, making payments, or triggering smart home actions. It's a wearable device that combines convenience and technology.

name: 5V RELAY
description: A 5V relay is an electronic switch designed to operate with a 5V DC working voltage. It is used to control the flow of current in a circuit, allowing a low-power signal (from a microcontroller like Arduino or Raspberry Pi) to switch on or off a higher-power load, such as lights, appliances, or motors, in home automation, automotive electronics, and IoT projects.

name: LM2560 DC-DC
description: The LM2560 DC-DC is a buck converter module designed to efficiently step down a higher DC voltage to a lower, regulated DC output voltage. It is used in IoT projects to provide the correct voltage level needed by various components (like microcontrollers or sensors) from a higher voltage source (like a battery or power supply).

name: MP1584 DC-DC
description: The MP1584 DC-DC module is a high-frequency step-down switching regulator (buck converter) that efficiently converts a higher input voltage (4.5V to 28V) into a lower output voltage (down to 0.8V, often configured for 5V in these modules). It is used to provide stable, regulated power to other components in an IoT or electronics project, particularly where high efficiency is required.

name: USB TTL UART
description: A USB TTL UART adapter is a device used to communicate between a computer's USB port and a target device's Transistor-Transistor Logic (TTL) serial port. It allows you to debug, program, and interact with microcontrollers and other devices that use UART (Universal Asynchronous Receiver/Transmitter) communication, by converting the USB signals to 3.3V or 5V TTL logic levels.

name: MICRO SD CARD ADAPTER
description: Allows a microcontroller or single-board computer (like an Arduino or Raspberry Pi) to read and write data to a standard Micro SD card, providing non-volatile storage.

name: LM393 SOUND SENSOR
description: Functions as a microphone and voltage comparator to detect sound, providing a digital output when the sound level surpasses a set threshold.

name: NEO6M GPS
description: The NEO6M GPS module is a receiver that uses the U-blox NEO-6M chip to provide location information (latitude, longitude, altitude) and time data. It communicates with microcontrollers via a UART interface and is commonly used in Internet of Things (IoT) projects for tracking and navigation.

name: LoRa AI THINKER 433
description: The LORA AI THINKER 433 (Ra-02, based on the SX1278 wireless transceiver) is a wireless transmission module that uses advanced LoRa spread spectrum technology. It is known for its strong anti-jamming ability and long communication distance (up to 10-15 KM). It is suitable for applications like reading counters, smart homes, and alarm equipment.

name: LORA ANTENNA
description: The LoRa Antenna is used to facilitate long-range, low-power wireless communication for LoRaWAN applications, enabling IoT devices to transmit data over great distances with minimal battery consumption. They are commonly used in smart cities, agriculture, and industrial IoT for monitoring and tracking.

name: NRF24L01+PA+LNA
description: This is a 2.4GHz RF Transceiver Module based on the Nordic nRF24L01+, with an integrated Power Amplifier (PA) and Low-Noise-Amplifier (LNA) to extend the range up to 1,000 meters. It operates in the worldwide license-free 2.4GHz ISM band and supports 250kbps, 1Mbps, and 2Mbps on-air data rates. It is commonly used for wireless communication in low-power applications.

name: JOY STICK
description: A joystick is an input device consisting of a stick that pivots on a base and reports its angle or direction to the device it is controlling. It's often used for control in robotics and gaming projects.

name: TP4056 CHARGING MODULE
description: Used for charging rechargeable lithium batteries using the constant-current/constant-voltage (CC/CV) method and provides necessary protection for lithium batteries.

name: WHITE LED
description: A WHITE LED (Light Emitting Diode) is an electronic light source used to indicate status, provide illumination, or serve as an output component in IoT projects. It emits white light when a voltage is applied.

name: RED LED
description: A red light-emitting diode (LED) is a semiconductor light source that emits light when current flows through it. In IoT, LEDs are commonly used as indicators (status, power, warning) or as simple light sources.

name: BLUE LED
description: A Blue LED (Light Emitting Diode) is a semiconductor light source that emits light when current flows through it. It is commonly used as an indicator light, for illumination (in combination with other colors), and in electronic displays.

name: GREEN LED
description: Emits green light; commonly used as a visual indicator or for low-power illumination in various electronic projects and circuits.

name: YELLOW LED
description: A yellow LED (Light Emitting Diode) is a semiconductor light source that emits light when current flows through it. In IoT applications, LEDs are commonly used as indicators for status, alerts, or simple illumination.

name: ORANGE LED
description: An ORANGE LED (Light Emitting Diode) is a small semiconductor light source that emits orange light when current passes through it. They are commonly used as indicator lights, in displays, or as a low-power light source in various electronic and IoT projects.

name: L298N DRIVER
description: The L298N DRIVER is a high-power motor driver module designed to control the speed and direction of DC motors and stepper motors. It can drive two DC motors or one four-phase stepper motor.

name: PAM 8610
description: The PAM8610 is a 10W per channel stereo Class-D audio power amplifier with DC volume control, designed to provide high-quality sound reproduction with low distortion and high efficiency, typically used in audio projects.

name: 18650 BATTERY CHARGER 2X2
description: This device is a charger specifically designed for 18650 Li-ion batteries (or similar sized batteries like 18650, depending on the exact model's specifications). It is used to safely recharge these batteries, typically supporting two batteries at once (as indicated by "2X2" likely meaning 2 slots).

name: 3M Wire
description: A 3-meter wire serves as a basic electrical conductor to connect components in an IoT project. It is used for power, ground, and signal connections.

name: COPPER WIRE
description: Copper wire is a highly conductive material used to transmit electrical signals and power between components in IoT devices, acting as the physical medium for connections.

name: 100uF 25V CAPACITOR
description: A 100uF 25V Capacitor is an electronic component that stores electrical energy in an electric field. The "100uF" specifies its capacitance (100 microfarads), and "25V" is the maximum voltage it can safely handle. In IoT devices, it is commonly used for filtering power supply noise, smoothing voltage fluctuations, and timing circuits.

name: 4.7uF 450v CAPACITOR
description: A capacitor stores electrical energy in an electric field. This specific capacitor, rated at 4.7 microfarads and 450 volts, is used to filter out noise, smooth power supply fluctuations, or couple/decouple signals in electronic circuits.

name: BC547B TRANSISTOR
description: The BC547B is an NPN Bipolar Junction Transistor (BJT). It is commonly used as a small signal amplifier and switch. Its functions include current amplification, such as in audio amplifiers and sensor signal conditioning, and as a driver in circuit control, like regulating current in LED drivers.

name: LM393 LDR MODULE
description: The LM393 LDR MODULE is a light sensing module that uses a Light Dependent Resistor (LDR) and an LM393 comparator to detect ambient light levels and provide a digital output signal. Its sensitivity is adjustable via an onboard potentiometer, making it suitable for applications like automatic lighting control, light level monitoring, and security systems.

name: 6MM LDR SENSOR
description: A 6MM LDR (Light Dependent Resistor) sensor changes its resistance based on the intensity of light falling on it, which allows it to be used for detecting light levels or presence.

name: 1 BOX SMALL RESISTER
description: Provides a variety of small, fixed-value resistors used to limit current, divide voltage, and set operating conditions in electronic circuits and IoT prototypes.

name: 1 BOX BIG RESISTER
description: A resistor is a passive two-terminal electrical component that implements electrical resistance as a circuit element. In a box of "big resistors," the function is to oppose the flow of electric current, used for things like setting signal levels, terminating transmission lines, and dividing voltage. These are likely larger physical size or higher power rating resistors compared to "small resistors."

name: 1MM 200M COPPER WIRE
description: This copper wire, insulated for safety, is used to carry electrical signals and power in electronic circuits. It's essential for creating connections between different components, especially for longer runs (200 meters) or when a slightly thicker gauge (1mm) is needed for carrying more current.

name: BUZZER
description: A buzzer is an audio signaling device, which may be mechanical, electromechanical, or piezoelectric. It is typically used to create a buzzing or alerting sound. In IoT projects, buzzers are used for simple audible feedback, alarms, or notifications.

name: SPEAKER 3W
description: A 3W speaker is an audio output component used to convert electrical audio signals into sound. It is typically used in IoT projects for sound alerts, music playback, or voice commands.

name: WIRES M-M
description: Male-to-male jumper wires are used to connect components on a breadboard or between two points, providing a flexible electrical connection without soldering.

name: WIRES M-F
description: Male-to-female jumper wires are used to connect components on a breadboard or microcontroller to components, such as sensors or actuators, that have female header pins.

name: WIRES F-F
description: Female-to-female jumper wires are used to connect two points, typically components with male headers or pins, on a breadboard or between development boards. They have sockets on both ends.

name: USB TYPE A-MICRO
description: A USB Type A-Micro cable is primarily used for both charging devices and transferring data between a device with a Micro USB port (common on many older mobile devices) and a standard USB Type-A port (common on computers or power adapters). It supports high-speed data transfer rates.

name: SanDisk Ultra 16GB Memory Card
description: An SD CARD 16GB is a non-volatile flash memory card used for storing digital information. It is commonly used in devices like cameras, smartphones, and IoT projects (like Raspberry Pi) to store operating systems, data, and applications.

name: SanDisk Ultra 32GB Memory Card
description: An SD CARD 32GB is a non-volatile flash memory card used for storing digital information. It is commonly used in devices like cameras, smartphones, and IoT projects (like Raspberry Pi) to store operating systems, data, and applications.

name: SanDisk Extreme 64GB Memory Card
description: SanDisk Extreme 64GB microSDXC UHS-I, V30, 170MB/s Read,80MB/s Write, Memory Card for 4K Video on Smartphones, Action Cams and Drones

name: 50 FT LAN CAT6
description: A 50 FT LAN CAT6 cable is used to connect devices within a local area network (LAN), providing high-speed data transmission up to 10 Gbps over shorter distances, making it suitable for networking equipment like computers, routers, and switches.

name: RASPBERRY PI CASE
description: A clip-together four-part enclosure designed to protect the Raspberry Pi and often includes an integrated, temperature-controlled cooling fan and heatsink to maintain optimal operating temperature.

name: RASPBERRY PI 27W 3A ADAPTER
description: A power adapter specifically designed to supply the correct voltage and current (usually 5.1V at 3A) to the Raspberry Pi 3 27W Model A+ for stable operation.

name: 12V 1A POWER ADAPTER
description: A 12V 1A power adapter converts AC power (like wall current) to 12V DC power at up to 1 amp, commonly used for powering low-voltage DC electronic devices such as LED strip lights or CCTV cameras.

name: WS2812B LED STRIP 5M
description: The WS2812B LED STRIP is a digitally addressable RGB LED strip. Each LED, which contains red, green, and blue LED chips and a built-in control IC, can be controlled individually using a single data line from a microcontroller. This allows for complex, dynamic lighting effects and the creation of over 16 million colors. It operates on 5V DC.

name: OFF WHITE LED STRIP
description: An LED strip that produces off-white light, commonly used for accent lighting or general illumination in IoT projects, providing a simple, flexible light source.

name: 12V 1A POWER SUPPLY MODULE
description: A power supply module, such as the 12V 1A, is designed to regulate and convert electrical power from a source to the voltage and current required by an electronic device or circuit. This particular model likely converts an input voltage to a stable 12V output and has a 1-amp (1A) capacity, providing reliable power to connected IoT components.

name: PUSH SWITCH
description: A push switch is a momentary switch that makes or breaks an electrical circuit connection only while the button is physically being pressed.

name: SLIDE SWITCH
description: A slide switch is a mechanical switch that uses a slider to connect or disconnect a circuit. It is commonly used as an on/off or selector switch in electronic projects and devices.

name: FEMALE PIN
description: A female pin connector is an electrical connector with one or more recessed holes or sockets, designed to accept a corresponding male pin. It is often used in electronics for making removable electrical connections, such as connecting jumper wires to headers on a microcontroller board.

name: MALE PIN
description: A male pin, often used in electronics and IoT, is a type of electrical connector with a solid conducting point designed to be inserted into a female connector (female pin header or socket). Its primary function is to create a reliable electrical connection between two parts of a circuit, often on breadboards, PCBs, or with jumper wires.

name: HDMI STANDARD TO MICROCABLE
description: To connect a device with a Micro HDMI (Type D) port to a standard HDMI port, you need a Micro HDMI to HDMI cable or adapter, which allows smaller devices like cameras, tablets, or the Raspberry Pi to display on larger screens (TVs, monitors), supporting high resolutions like 4K and backward compatibility with older HDMI standards.

name: 12V FEMALE JACK
description: 2V female sockets in two primary types: DC power jack sockets used for electronic projects and CCTV sockets used for automotive applications.

name: 4 Volt Led Light 8W
description: 4 Volt 8 Watt Bright SMD LED Bead Chips Bulb Light Lamp Multipurpose Use For Home, Temple Decoration DIY Projects, Hobby Kit (COOL WHITE)

name: 1.5V 1.8V 2.5V 3V 3.3V 3.7V 4.2V to 5V DC-DC DC Boost Converter Module Step Up Board
description: This is the voltage boost converter module provides 5V DC stable voltage output at various input range between 1.5V to 5V. This small tiny circuit boosts the voltage level and provides the amplified stabilized 5V output. For the different input range, it consumes a different amount of current to produce a balanced output.

name: Diode 1N4007
description: The 1N4007 is a widely used, inexpensive general-purpose silicon rectifier diode designed for converting alternating current (AC) to direct current (DC). It can handle a continuous forward current of up to 1 ampere and has a high peak inverse voltage (PIV) rating of 1,000 volts.
